title: Count the number of ways to traverse a 2D array
problem:
In this problem you are to count the number of ways of starting at the top-left corner of a 2D array and getting to the bottom-right corner. All moves must either go right or down. For example, we show three ways in a 5 x 5 2D array. See the figure for a better understanding. (Note, there are a total of 70 possible ways for this example.)

Paths through a 2D array.

Write a program that takes i and j values and returns the number of ways to the bottom-right corner.
hint: If i > 0 and j > 0, you can get to (i, j) from (i - 1, j) or (j - 1, i).
